Anmol Bhasin wrote:
> Crawl Scope question again. I want to crawl a particular site and only 
> the "pages" linked to it and not the entire linked sites.  I tried with 
> Max-hop-filter 1 and 2.
> 
> With 1 I end up crawling the seed site but nothing outside. With 2 its 
> crawls all the pages of the linked sites. I guess I am doing something 
> incorrectly, any guidance would be appreciated.

If I understand correctly, you want to crawl a site, plus any pages 
linked-to from that site -- "one hop off the target site".

The various max-hops settings generally count hops from your seeds, not 
hops from a site. There is a pending feature request (but with no target 
date/release) for generally supporting a scope which is 'n hops off' 
some other more focused sub-scope:

[ 1289245 ] n-hops-off decide rule / focus plus N hops scoping
https://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1289245&group_id=73833&atid=539102

However, if using a scope based on SURT-centric DecideRules -- which 
include the (Not)SurtPrefixedDecideRule, (Not)OnDomainsDecideRule, 
(Not)OnHostsDecideRule -- there is another setting which acheives 
essentially "1 hop off" scope expansion: 'also-check-via'.

If 'also-check-via' is true, the SURT-based scope check will be tried 
against both an URL and its 'via' (the URL from which is was 
discovered). If either is acceptable, the current URL is ruled in. The 
effect is generally to include anything discovered one hop away from the 
established SURT URL prefixes.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA
